alert.note: Alert for St. Louis; St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 7:40AM CDT until July 26 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL SAINT LOUIS COUNTY AND THE SAINT LOUIS CITY... At 740 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported multiple water rescues of homes and vehicles from the heavy rainfall. Between 4 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Louis, St. Charles, Florissant, Chesterfield, University City, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Creve Coeur, Overland, Clayton, Cahokia, Jennings, St. Ann, Crestwood, Bridgeton, Bellefontaine Neighbors and Town and Country. This includes the following State Parks... Scott Joplin Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri near exit 231. This includes the following streams and drainages... Louisville Creek, Mississippi River, Missouri River, Grand Glaize Creek, Martigney Creek, Shady Grove Creek, Cowmire Creek, Twomile Creek, Creve Coeur Creek, Gravois Creek, Glaize Creek, Deer Creek, Bonhomme Creek, Maline Creek, Caulks Creek and Smith Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
